findings.title: Broad IP assignment / ownership transfer language
findings.rationale: Assignment language may transfer ownership of work product or IP rather than granting a limited license.

3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All inventions, discoveries, and work product created by Employee during employment shall be the exclusive property of Employer. Employee hereby assigns all rights, title, and interest in such work product to Employer.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE

findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE Employee agrees to maintain confidentiality of all proprietary information indefinitely, even after termination of employment....

findings.title: Non-compete / non-solicit style restriction
findings.rationale: Restrictive covenants can limit future business activity; enforceability varies and is commonly negotiated.

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.

9. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Employer shall be entitled to recover all attorneys' fees and costs in any action to enforce this Agreement.

10. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of California.

This Agreement is effective as of January 1, 2024.

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
